result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chiong Vang

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Travis Slattery
Review hearing on October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case Called: 8:48 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, pro se. Atty Kat Yanke appears in person on behalf of the SPD Office. 
VRCW.
Date and time set to address the Defendant's counsel status. 
SPD Office has filed a document regarding number of contacts made attempting to find counsel for Defendant. 
Atty Yanke makes statements; Defendant does have a pending revocation file. 
Defendant wishes to have counsel for the Preliminary Hearing. Court finds cause to extend time limits for the holding of the preliminary hearing.
Review Hearing to be scheduled in two weeks. Court will address the Defendant's Indigency Request at the review hearing if the SPD Office has not appointed counsel before that time.
